intro: Hedyotis polypremoides var. bigelovii, commonly known as Bigelow's bluetail, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert or arid environments.
